images.title: Bird-Headed Man and Bison (Lascaux Cave)
images.medium: Charcoal Drawing

images.title: Bison (Altamira Cave)
images.medium: Relief (bison stands out from the background)

images.title: Four Horses (Chauvet Cave)
images.medium: Charcoal Wall Painting

images.title: Lamp with Ibex Design
images.medium: Animal desig engrave on stone

images.title: Woman from Willendorf (Willendorf, Austria)
images.medium: Sculpture

images.title: Man and Woman (Romania)
images.medium: Ceramic Sculpture (Made from clay with bone and ashes added)

images.title: Horse and Sun Chariot (Denmark)
images.medium: Sculpture (Sun disk engraved gold with curved patterns)

images.title: Mammoth Bone House (Ukraine)
images.medium: Houses (using bones of the Wooly Mammoth, bones were covered with animal hides and natural materials to keep the inside warm)

images.title: Stonehenge (Wiltshire, England)
images.medium: Circle of stones surrounded by a ditch, Post and Lintel Construction, Stones from southern Wales

images.title: Votive Statues of Worshippers
images.medium: gypsum, shell, black limestone, various heights (tallest 30 inches high)

images.title: Warka Vase (Uruk, (Modern Warka), Iraq)
images.medium: Relief Sculpture (Vase), Alabaster (mineral), 3 feet high, Reliefs depict Inanna (Sumerian Goddess of love, beauty, and war – also known as Ishtar in other parts of Mesopotamia)

images.title: Anu Ziggurat (Ancient Uruk (modern Warka, Iraq))
images.medium: Architecture (Temple), Ziggurats showed the wealth and power of the Sumerians

images.title: Bull Lyre
images.medium: Musical Instrument, Wood, Shell Inlay, Lapis Lazuli, Gold Leaf, 2 meters high, (Bull: symbol of strength and power)

images.title: Bull Lyre
images.medium: Musical Instrument, Found in Tomb, Wood, Shell Inlay, Lapis Lazuli, Gold Leaf, 2 meters high, (Bull: symbol of strength and power)

images.title: Head of an Akkadian Ruler
images.medium: Copper, 14 in. high, Portrait of an Unknown Ruler, Dignity and Authority, Earliest hollow cast metal sculpture, Stylized beard, hair, and clothing

images.title: Votive Statue of Gudea
images.medium: Sculpture (Carved Stone), 73.7 cm Tall, Gudea was the leader of Lagash (modern Telloh, Iraq)

images.title: Stele of Hammurabi
images.medium: Sculpture (carved stone/relief) 2.13 Meters Tall, Hammurabi: King of Ancient Babylon, Stele: Vertical Upright Monument, Contains early set of written laws, Cuneiform writing, Conversation between Hammurabi and Shamash, the sun God

images.title: Lamassu (Assyrian)
images.medium: Carved Limestone, 13’10 high, Human-headed winged lion and bull, Served to ward off enemies and to guard Kings, Partly “in the round” and part relief, Front view at rest / side view in movement

images.title: Reconstruction Drawing of citadel of Sargon II (Assyrian)
Assurnasirpal II Killing Lions (Assyrian)
images.medium: Relief (carved Stone), 99.1 cm Tall, Lion hunting scene (Theme of Man and Nature), Assurnasirpal II was the leader of Assyria, Assyrian ruler built huge palaces: these palaces were decorated with relief carvings

images.title: Ishtar Gate (Lion) (Babylon)
images.medium: Architecture (Glazed Brick)

images.title: Ishtar Gate (Babylon)
images.medium: Architecture (Glazed Brick), Entrance to the Ancient city of Babylon, Lions: Symbols of Goddess Ishtar, Crenellated Towers, Glazed Bricks used to make the gate are long lasting and strong

images.title: Ishtar Gate reconstruction drawing (Babylon)
images.medium: Architecture (Glazed Brick), Entrance to the Ancient city of Babylon, Lions: Symbols of Goddess Ishtar, Crenellated Towers, Glazed Bricks used to make the gate are long lasting and strong

images.title: Persepolis: Palace of Darius I and Xerxes I (Persepolis, Iran)
images.medium: Buildings separated by streets and open spaces, Columned hall was dominant structure, Standing on a rock cut platform, Stone used throughout the palace, Forms of figures derived from Egyptian style (Persians traded with the Egyptians)

images.title: Persepolis: Palace of Darius I and Xerxes I (Persepolis, Iran)
images.medium: Buildings separated by streets and open spaces, Columned hall was dominant structure, Standing on a rock cut platform, Stone used throughout the palace, Forms of figures derived from Egyptian style (Persians traded with the Egyptians)

images.title: Persepolis: Palace of Darius I and Xerxes I (Persepolis, Iran)
images.medium: Buildings separated by streets and open spaces, Columned hall was dominant structure, Standing on a rock cut platform, Stone used throughout the palace, Forms of figures derived from Egyptian style (Persians traded with the Egyptians)

images.title: Stepped Pyramid of Djoser
images.medium: Architecture, Limestone, Tomb for King Djoser, Burial Chamber below ground

images.title: Great Pyramids of Giza
images.medium: Architecture (tombs), for King Mankaura, King Khafre and King Khufu (tallest: 137 meters), contained false passageways

images.title: The Great Sphinx
images.medium: Portraits of King Khafra

images.title: Khafre
images.medium: Carved Anorthosite Gneiss (rare stone, glows a deep blue in sunlight, celestial color of Horus (falcon God who protects the King)), wears royal clothing, head dress in the shape of a cobra (represents the sun god), fake beard, Conveys dignity, calmness, and permanence

images.title: Funerary Mask of Tutankhamun
images.medium: Gold inlaid with glass and semiprecious stones, height 54 cm, Tomb filled with treasures

images.title: Inner Coffin of Tutankhamen’s Sarcophagus
images.medium: Gold inlaid with glass and semiprecious stones, height 54 cm, Tomb filled with treasures

images.title: Nefertiti
images.medium: Painted Limestone, Height 51 cm, Egyptian beauty ideal, Dramatic use of color

images.title: Rosetta Stone
images.medium: Ancient Egyptian stele originally displayed in a temple, key to understanding Egyptian hieroglyphic, Decree issued by King Ptolemy V; top part: ancient hieroglyphics, middle part: Egyptian demotic writing, lower part: ancient Greek writing

images.title: Akhenaten and his Family
images.medium: Sunken relief, Royal Family Portrait (King Akhenaten on left, Queen Nefertiti on the right, 3 of their daughters), Hieroglyphics in background

images.title: Queen Nefertari Making an Offering to Isis
images.medium: Wall Painting in the Tomb of Nefertari, preparing for her death, Hieroglyphics in background

images.title: Palette of Narmer
images.medium: Green schist (stone relief), Stone Palette possibly used for ceremonies

images.title: Ti Watching a Hippopotamus Hunt
images.medium: Painted Limestone Relief, Ti was a court official, Surveying Hippo hunts was a duty of court officials, Hippos were thought to be destructive since they wandered into fields, damaging crops, Symbolizes victory of good over evil
